items.title: 塔吉特季度销售额下降超预期，备战关键假期季
items.summary: 美国零售巨头**塔吉特**近日公布了其季度销售数据，结果显示销售额下降幅度超出了市场预期。尽管面临挑战，塔吉特正在积极准备即将到来的关键假期购物季，以期扭转局面。这一下降可能与消费者购物习惯的变化、市场竞争加剧以及宏观经济环境的不确定性有关。塔吉特表示，他们正在通过调整库存、优化供应链和增强在线购物体验等措施来应对当前的挑战，并期待在假期季实现销售的反弹。
comments: 塔吉特一直是我购物的首选地，希望他们能在假期季打个漂亮的翻身仗！
销售额下降这么多，塔吉特是不是该考虑调整一下他们的营销策略了？
虽然销售额下降了，但塔吉特的服务质量还是值得信赖的，希望他们能尽快恢复增长。
塔吉特的竞争对手沃尔玛和亚马逊表现如何？这可能是整个零售行业的问题。
假期季是零售商的关键时刻，塔吉特如果能抓住机会，或许能弥补之前的损失。
items.originalTitle: Target posts bigger-than-expected drop in quarterly sales, readies for key holiday period
items.originalSummary: Target posts bigger-than-expected drop in quarterly sales, readies for key holiday period
items.marketReaction: 塔吉特的这一消息可能会对市场产生一定的影响。投资者可能会对零售行业的前景感到担忧，尤其是对于那些同样面临销售压力的零售商。**塔吉特**的股票可能会因为这一消息而承压，尤其是在短期内。然而，如果塔吉特能够在假期季实现强劲的销售表现，这可能会缓解市场的担忧，并可能带动股价的回升。长期来看，市场将关注塔吉特如何应对当前的挑战，并调整其业务策略以适应不断变化的零售环境。

items.title: 对冲基金正在买入这两家大型科技股，同时抛售两家竞争对手
items.summary: 近期，对冲基金的投资动向引起了市场的关注。根据最新的市场分析，对冲基金正在积极买入两家大型科技股，而与此同时，它们也在抛售两家竞争对手的股票。这种投资策略可能是基于对这些公司未来增长潜力和市场竞争力的评估。对冲基金的这种操作可能会对市场产生一定的影响，因为它们通常拥有较大的资金量和影响力，能够引导市场趋势。具体来说，被买入的两家大型科技股可能会因为资金流入而股价上涨，而被抛售的两家竞争对手则可能面临股价下跌的压力。这种资金流动也反映了市场对不同科技公司前景的不同看法和预期。
comments: 对冲基金的操作总是让人捉摸不透，不过这次买入大型科技股，看来是对这些公司的未来发展很有信心啊。
抛售竞争对手的股票，是不是意味着这些公司的未来前景不被看好？这对整个科技行业来说是个警示。
对冲基金的这种操作可能会引发市场的跟风效应，不过还是要看这些公司的基本面和长期发展潜力。
科技股的波动总是很大，对冲基金的这种操作可能会加剧市场的波动性，投资者需要谨慎。
对冲基金的这种操作，是不是也反映了市场对科技股的分化？一些公司可能会因此受益，而另一些则可能面临挑战。
items.originalTitle: Hedge funds are buying these two big tech stocks while selling two rivals
items.originalSummary: Hedge funds are buying these two big tech stocks while selling two rivals
items.marketReaction: 对冲基金的这种操作可能会对市场产生显著影响。被买入的两家大型科技股可能会因为资金流入而股价上涨，这可能会吸引更多的投资者关注和跟风，从而进一步推高股价。同时，被抛售的两家竞争对手可能会面临股价下跌的压力，这可能会导致投资者信心下降，进而影响公司的市值和市场地位。此外，这种资金流动也可能引发市场对科技股整体趋势的重新评估，特别是对于那些在竞争中处于劣势的公司。

items.title: 波音在迪拜航展上凭借flydubai订单部分回归
items.summary: 在迪拜航展上，波音公司通过与flydubai的订单实现了部分回归。这次订单标志着波音在经历一系列挑战后，重新获得市场信任的开始。flydubai作为阿联酋的一家航空公司，其订单对于波音来说是一个积极的信号，表明其飞机产品仍然受到市场的青睐。尽管波音在737 MAX事件后面临了信任危机，但此次订单显示波音正在逐步恢复其在全球航空市场中的地位。这对于波音来说是一个重要的里程碑，也是其重建声誉和市场份额的关键一步。
comments: 波音终于开始恢复了，希望他们能从过去的失误中吸取教训，制造更安全的飞机。
flydubai的订单对波音来说是个好消息，但波音需要更多的订单来证明他们已经完全回归。
这只是一个开始，波音要想重回巅峰，还有很长的路要走。
波音的回归对航空业是个好消息，竞争能推动技术进步，希望他们能带来更多创新。
虽然波音获得了订单，但我还是对他们的安全性有所保留，希望他们能彻底解决所有问题。
items.originalTitle: Boeing stages partial comeback at Dubai Airshow with flydubai jet order
items.originalSummary: Boeing stages partial comeback at Dubai Airshow with flydubai jet order
items.marketReaction: 波音公司在迪拜航展上获得flydubai的订单，可能会对**波音**的股价产生积极影响，因为这显示了市场对波音飞机的信心正在恢复。同时，这也可能会对航空制造业的其他竞争者如**空客**造成一定的压力，因为波音的回归可能会增加市场竞争。对于投资者而言，这可能是一个积极的信号，表明波音的业务正在逐步回到正轨，可能会考虑增加对**波音**股票的投资。

items.title: TikTok 新增AI生成内容控制功能，用户可自定义内容比例
items.summary: TikTok 最近推出了一项新功能，允许用户控制他们希望在平台上看到多少由人工智能生成的内容。这项更新意味着用户可以根据自己的喜好调整内容比例，如果用户希望减少AI生成内容的曝光，他们可以相应地调整设置；相反，如果用户喜欢这类内容，他们可以选择增加这类内容的展示。这一变化为用户提供了更多的个性化选择，同时也反映了TikTok对用户反馈的响应和对平台内容多样性的重视。
comments: 这个功能太棒了，我早就不想看到那些无聊的AI视频了，现在终于可以清净一下了。
TikTok越来越懂我们了，这样的个性化设置真的很贴心。
我倒是挺喜欢AI内容的，感觉挺新鲜的，这下可以看个够了。
这个功能会不会让内容质量下降啊，毕竟AI生成的东西有时候挺没营养的。
哈哈，这下可以自己当内容的导演了，想怎么看就怎么看，TikTok这波操作可以的。
items.originalTitle: TikTok now lets you choose how much AI-generated content you want to see
items.originalSummary: With the new AI-generated content control, users who want to see less of this sort of content can dial things down, while those who enjoy it can choose to see more of it.
items.marketReaction: 这一更新可能会对TikTok的用户参与度产生积极影响，因为它增强了用户体验的个性化。用户能够更精确地控制他们看到的内容，这可能会增加他们在平台上的停留时间。对于广告商来说，这意味着他们可以更精准地定位感兴趣的用户群体，可能会提高广告效率和转化率。从市场反应来看，这种对用户体验的重视可能会对TikTok的**用户增长**和**广告收入**产生正面影响。

items.title: Hugging Face CEO：我们处于‘大型语言模型’泡沫，而非AI泡沫
items.summary: Hugging Face的联合创始人兼首席执行官Clem Delangue表示，虽然目前所有的目光都集中在大型语言模型（LLMs）上，但在许多用例中，未来更小、更专业的模型将更有意义。Delandgue认为，大型语言模型虽然在某些领域表现出色，但在特定任务和应用中，小型、定制化的模型可能会提供更好的性能和效率。这种观点强调了AI技术发展的多样性和专业化，预示着未来AI应用将更加细分和精准。
comments: 看来AI的发展越来越精细化了，这对我们这些小公司来说是个好消息，终于有机会在大公司面前露脸了。
我不太同意这个观点，大型语言模型在很多领域都有广泛的应用，不可能被小模型完全取代。
这个CEO说得有道理，AI技术的发展不应该只局限于大型模型，多样化才是未来的趋势。
哈哈，看来我们这些搞小模型的终于要翻身了，大型模型的好日子到头了。
我觉得这个观点有点片面，大型模型和小模型各有优势，未来应该是两者并存的局面。
items.originalTitle: Hugging Face CEO says we’re in an ‘LLM bubble,’ not an AI bubble
items.originalSummary: Hugging Face co-founder and CEO Clem Delangue says all the attention is on LLMs, but smaller, specialized models will make sense in many use cases going forward.
items.marketReaction: 这一观点可能会对市场产生深远影响。一方面，它可能会促使投资者和企业重新评估对大型语言模型的投资和应用，转而关注那些更小、更专业的AI模型。另一方面，这也可能推动AI行业的创新和多样化，鼓励更多的初创企业和小型团队开发和应用这些定制化的AI解决方案。对于**Hugging Face**这样的公司来说，这可能是一个机会，通过提供更多样化的AI产品和服务来扩大市场份额。

items.title: AI数据中心提供商Lambda在与**微软**达成数十亿美元交易后，惊人地筹集了15亿美元
items.summary: AI数据中心提供商Lambda在与科技巨头**微软**达成一项价值数十亿美元的交易后，成功筹集了高达15亿美元的资金。这一筹资额超出了市场观察人士预期的目标，显示出投资者对Lambda及其在AI数据中心领域潜力的高度认可。Lambda的这一成就不仅为其未来的发展提供了充足的资金支持，也可能进一步巩固其在竞争激烈的AI数据中心市场中的地位。
comments: Lambda这次筹资太给力了，看来AI数据中心的前景真的很广阔啊！
15亿美元！Lambda这是要起飞的节奏啊，不知道会不会成为下一个行业巨头。
与**微软**的合作对Lambda来说是个巨大的机遇，期待他们能带来更多的创新。
虽然筹资成功是好事，但Lambda还是要关注如何将这些资金有效地转化为业务增长。
Lambda这次筹资成功，会不会让其他AI数据中心公司感到压力山大啊，期待行业的竞争格局变化。
items.originalTitle: AI data center provider Lambda raises whopping $1.5B after multibillion-dollar Microsoft deal
items.originalSummary: Lambda's new raise was a solid beat over the amount that deal-watchers say it was hoping to hit.
items.marketReaction: Lambda的这一筹资成功可能会对AI数据中心行业产生显著影响。投资者对Lambda的信心增强可能会吸引更多的资金流入该行业，推动相关技术和服务的发展。同时，Lambda的竞争对手可能会感受到压力，需要加大研发投入以保持竞争力。对于**微软**而言，与Lambda的合作可能会加强其在AI领域的布局，提升其在云计算市场的竞争力。市场可能会对Lambda的股价和相关AI数据中心股票产生积极预期，推动股价上涨。

items.title: Gartner 数据与分析峰会为2026年扩展AI议程
items.summary: 根据预测，到2027年，**一半**的商业决策将由AI代理增强或自动化，以实现决策智能。这一重大转变正在改变组织的运作方式，AI领导者面临着适应、创新并引导团队穿越复杂性的压力。**Gartner数据与分析峰会2026**旨在帮助这些领导者应对挑战。峰会将聚焦于AI在决策智能中的应用，探讨如何通过AI技术提升业务决策的效率和准确性。随着AI技术的发展，企业需要重新思考其决策流程，利用AI的数据分析和预测能力来优化业务策略。
comments: 哇，AI在决策中的作用越来越大了，看来未来我们真的离不开这些智能助手了！
这个峰会听起来很有前瞻性，希望能看到一些实际的AI应用案例，而不仅仅是理论讨论。
AI在商业决策中的应用是大势所趋，但同时也要警惕数据隐私和伦理问题。
哈哈，看来以后老板们都要依赖AI来做决策了，不知道会不会有AI版的‘老板’出现。
虽然AI可以帮助提高决策效率，但我觉得人类的直觉和经验还是不可替代的，不能完全依赖机器。

items.marketReaction: 这一消息可能会对AI和数据分析领域的公司产生积极影响，尤其是那些专注于决策智能解决方案的公司。投资者可能会对这些领域的公司表现出更大的兴趣，因为它们被视为未来商业决策的关键技术。市场可能会对那些能够提供先进AI解决方案的公司，如**谷歌**、**亚马逊**和**微软**等，给予更多的关注。同时，这也可能会推动相关技术股的价格上涨，尤其是那些在AI领域有显著研发投入和创新能力的公司。

items.title: 微软、英伟达和Anthropic结成AI计算联盟
items.summary: **微软**、**Anthropic**和**英伟达**宣布建立一个新的计算联盟，旨在为云基础设施投资和AI模型的可用性树立新的标杆。这一协议标志着从单一模型依赖向多元化、硬件优化的生态系统转变，改变了高级技术领导者的治理格局。**微软**首席执行官萨提亚·纳德拉表示，这种关系是一种互惠的整合，其中各方将共同推动AI技术的发展和应用。这一联盟可能会对AI领域产生深远影响，因为它涉及到三个在AI技术、云计算和硬件优化方面具有强大实力的公司。
comments: 这个联盟太强大了，微软、英伟达和Anthropic的合作将会改变AI的未来！
这种合作对行业的影响是巨大的，但我想知道这会对小型AI公司产生什么影响？
微软和英伟达的合作早就该来了，现在AI领域竞争这么激烈，不合作怎么行？
Anthropic在这个联盟中扮演什么角色？我对他们的技术很感兴趣，希望能看到更多的信息。
哈哈，这下谷歌和亚马逊要紧张了，微软和英伟达的联盟肯定会给他们带来压力。

items.marketReaction: 这一联盟可能会对市场产生显著影响。投资者可能会对**微软**、**英伟达**的股票产生积极反应，因为这种合作可能会增强这些公司在AI领域的竞争力。同时，这种合作可能会推动整个AI行业向更高效、更优化的方向发展，对整个行业产生正面影响。预计与AI相关的其他公司，如**谷歌**和**亚马逊**，可能会面临更大的竞争压力，需要加强自身的技术创新和合作。

items.title: 量子物理学家缩小并“去审查”DeepSeek R1
items.summary: 一群量子物理学家声称他们已经创建了一个版本的强大的推理人工智能模型**DeepSeek R1**，该版本去除了中国创造者在原始模型中内置的审查功能。这些科学家来自**Multiverse Computing**，这是一家专门从事量子启发式人工智能技术的西班牙公司，他们创建了**DeepSeek R1 Slim**，这是一个比原始模型小55%的模型。这一改进不仅减少了模型的体积，还去除了审查机制，使得模型的应用更加自由和开放。这对于人工智能领域来说是一个重要的进步，因为它展示了量子技术在提升AI性能和去除限制方面的潜力。
comments: 哇，量子技术真的能改变游戏规则，去除了审查的AI模型听起来很棒！
这是不是意味着我们可以用这个模型做更多的事情了？期待看到它在实际应用中的表现。
55%的缩小听起来很厉害，但是性能会不会受到影响呢？希望不要只是体积小了，性能也缩水。
量子计算和AI的结合，这可能是未来的大趋势，**Multiverse Computing**走在了前面。
哈哈，这下中国的创造者们可能要头疼了，他们的审查机制被破解了。
items.originalTitle: Quantum physicists have shrunk and “de-censored” DeepSeek R1
items.originalSummary: A group of quantum physicists claims to have created a version of the powerful reasoning AI model DeepSeek R1 that strips out the censorship built into the original by its Chinese creators.  The scientists at Multiverse Computing, a Spanish firm specializing in quantum-inspired AI techniques, created DeepSeek R1 Slim, a model that is 55% smaller…
items.marketReaction: 这一消息可能会对人工智能和量子计算领域的市场产生积极影响。投资者可能会对**Multiverse Computing**的技术进步表示兴趣，这可能会推动其股价上涨。同时，对于那些寻求更自由、更开放AI解决方案的企业来说，**DeepSeek R1 Slim**的推出可能会增加他们对量子启发式AI技术的兴趣，从而可能影响整个行业的发展趋势。

items.title: 为人工智能构建网络：打造实时智能的基础
items.summary: 莱德杯是一项拥有近一个世纪历史的高尔夫锦标赛，它将欧洲与美国在高尔夫技巧和策略的精英展示中进行对决。在2025年的比赛中，近二十五万观众聚集在一起，观看了三天激烈的比赛。从技术和物流的角度来看，成功举办这样的赛事需要强大的网络基础设施来支持。为了应对这一挑战，组织者采用了先进的人工智能（AI）技术来优化网络连接，确保赛事的实时智能需求得到满足。通过构建一个强大的网络基础，组织者能够实时监控赛事动态，提高观众体验，并确保赛事的顺利进行。这种技术的应用不仅提升了赛事的观赏性，也为未来的大型活动提供了一个实时智能的范例。
comments: 太棒了，人工智能和网络技术的结合让莱德杯这样的大型赛事更加精彩，期待未来能有更多这样的创新应用！
这种技术的应用对于提升观众体验确实很有帮助，但我想知道它对普通消费者来说是否也实用。

哈哈，以后看比赛是不是可以不用去现场了，直接在家里通过VR体验？科技真是越来越神奇了！

items.title: 实现大规模生产中的AI推理价值
items.summary: 训练一个AI模型来预测设备故障是一项工程成就。但只有当预测转化为行动——即模型成功标记出故障机器的那一刻——真正的商业变革才会发生。一个技术里程碑存在于概念验证演示中；另一个则对**底线**有实质性的贡献。**Craig Partridge**，**Digital Next**的全球高级总监，强调了将AI推理从概念验证阶段转移到大规模生产中的重要性。这意味着不仅要训练模型，还要确保模型能够在实际环境中准确、可靠地运行，从而为企业带来实际的经济效益。
comments: 太棒了，AI技术终于从理论走向了实际应用，这才是真正的创新！
将AI推理应用到生产中听起来很高大上，但我想知道这是否真的能带来成本效益。
这是不是意味着我们的工作会被机器取代？AI的发展真的让人既兴奋又害怕。
Craig Partridge的观点很有启发性，AI的商业价值确实需要在实际应用中得到验证。
看来AI技术的发展不仅仅是技术问题，更多的是如何将技术转化为实际的商业成果。

items.title: OpenAI与Target合作推出基于ChatGPT的全新AI购物体验

这是不是意味着我们的购物习惯会被**AI**分析，然后被用来卖更多东西给我们？有点担心隐私问题。
**AI**在零售业的应用越来越广泛了，这可能会改变我们购物的方式，期待看到更多的创新。
个性化购物听起来不错，但希望**Target**能处理好数据安全问题，别让黑客有机可乘。

items.title: AI成为我意想不到的日常旅行伴侣
items.summary: 人工智能（AI）在旅行规划中展现出了巨大的潜力。**The Verge**的一篇文章讲述了作者和他的妻子以及宠物狗在欧洲自驾游的经历。他们没有具体的行程安排，而是根据风和阳光的变化来决定旅行方向，同时还要兼顾日常工作。在这种情况下，AI的旅行规划能力成为了他们不可或缺的专家。他们越来越依赖于**Gemini**和**ChatGPT**等免费AI工具来帮助选择下一个目的地。这一切始于一个简单的查询，作者在一次25公里的徒步旅行后感到疲惫，只剩下几个小时的日光，于是开始使用AI来规划他们的旅行。AI的这种应用不仅提高了旅行的效率，也增加了旅行的乐趣和灵活性。
comments: 哇，AI现在都能帮我们规划旅行了，真是太神奇了！以后出门旅游是不是连脑子都不用带了？
我觉得这种依赖AI规划旅行的方式可能会让旅行失去一些探索的乐趣，我还是喜欢自己规划行程。
这篇文章让我对AI的实用性有了新的认识，原来它还能这么用，看来AI的发展真的超出了我的想象。
虽然AI规划旅行听起来很方便，但我还是担心隐私问题，毕竟要提供很多个人信息给这些工具。
哈哈，AI成了旅行伴侣，那是不是以后还能发展出AI导游？想想就觉得很有趣。

items.title: 《堡垒之夜》将引入**Unity**游戏
items.summary: Epic Games与游戏开发领域的主要竞争对手**Unity**合作，将使用**Unity**引擎制作的游戏引入《堡垒之夜》。这一变化意味着**Unity**游戏将与Epic自家的体验以及第三方开发者使用**Unreal Editor**为《堡垒之夜》创建的游戏并列，为《堡垒之夜》内可玩的游戏数量大幅增加打开了大门。Epic Games CEO Tim Sweeney表示，公司相信为了构建一个互操作且公平的开放元宇宙，公司需要合作。这一合作是Epic将《堡垒之夜》转变为一个开放元宇宙的重要一步，Epic已经通过增加创作者制作体验的比重，使浏览这些体验的过程类似于浏览YouTube，甚至可以在网页上查看体验并购买新的《堡垒之夜》服装。目前，《堡垒之夜》是一个封闭的生态系统，创作者只能使用Epic的工具为平台制作游戏，还不能轻松地将这些游戏导入**Unreal Engine**以带到其他平台，或者将其他引擎上构建的体验带入《堡垒之夜》。但Epic已经成功地将《堡垒之夜》从一个战斗皇家游戏扩展到一个类似**Roblox**的广泛生态系统，拥有来自外部创作者的大量游戏。到去年年底，已有70,000名创作者发布了近200,000个“岛屿”，即《堡垒之夜》对体验的称呼。而**Unity Editor**每月有超过120万活跃用户，即使只有一部分开发者也将他们的游戏带到《堡垒之夜》，也可能为平台增加很多内容。
comments: 哇，Epic Games和Unity合作，这简直是游戏界的大新闻，期待《堡垒之夜》里能玩到更多好游戏！
这是不是意味着《堡垒之夜》要变成一个真正的元宇宙平台了？感觉Epic的野心不小啊。
Unity的用户基础这么大，这对《堡垒之夜》来说肯定是个大利好，但会不会对其他平台造成冲击呢？
虽然听起来很酷，但我想知道这会不会让《堡垒之夜》变得太复杂，影响游戏体验。
哈哈，Epic和Unity联手，这是要打造游戏界的超级平台吗？不过，只要游戏好玩，我不在乎它们怎么合作。
items.originalTitle: Fortnite is getting Unity games
items.originalSummary:
Epic Games is teaming up with arguably its biggest game development rival, Unity, to bring games made using Unity’s engine into Fortnite. The change will mean that Unity games could sit alongside Epic’s own suite of experiences as well as those created by third-party developers using the Unreal Editor for Fortnite — and it opens the door for significantly more games to be available to play within Fortnite.
“Just like the early days of the web, we believe that companies need to work together in order to build the open metaverse in a way that’s interoperable and fair,” Epic Games CEO Tim Sweeney says in a statement. “Working alongside Unity we’re helping developers build fun games, reach bigger audiences, and find success.”
The change represents an important step in Epic’s long-running vision of turning Fortnite into an open metaverse that’s a big 3D social space with a huge number of experiences to participate in with your friends. Epic has been marching down this path for years with Fortnite itself by putting an increased focus on creator-made experiences and making browsing through those experiences in the Fortnite lobby feel like scrolling YouTube. You can even check out experiences on the web — and buy new Fortnite outfits in your browser, too.
Right now, Fortnite is a closed ecosystem, meaning that creators can only make games for the platform using Epic’s tools, can’t (yet) easily drop those games into Unreal Engine to bring them to other platforms, or bring experiences built on other engines into Fortnite. But even in 2023, Tim Sweeney was telling The Verge how much he believed in the future of interoperable game engines being key to his vision.
Epic has had some success expanding Fortnite from being a battle royale into a broad, Roblox-like ecosystem with games from outside creators. By the end of last year, it had 70,000 total creators that published nearly 200,000 “islands,” or Fortnite’s term for experiences. But the Unity Editor, which is designed to help developers build their games once and run them across multiple platforms, has more than 1.2 million monthly active users. Even a fraction of those developers also bringing their games to Fortnite could add a lot to the platform.
The plan is to allow Unity games to come to Fortnite next year, Matt Bromberg, President and CEO of Unity, tells The Verge.
The partnership potentially gives developers another potential avenue to find an audience and monetize their games, which could be a lifeline for smaller developers amid continued industry struggles and layoffs. It could also consolidate even more power into Fortnite, which is already a behemoth. But Sweeney actually envisions a world for Fortnite that’s much more decentralized — more like the open web.
“Fortnite’s still this big thing operated by Epic completely,” Sweeney says. “But there will be a day when you can, from the program that’s currently called Fortnite, go to other sites that are completely controlled by other companies. We have nothing to do with them. We make no revenue from them. We don’t have commercial agreements with them. They’re just like websites on the web.” Today’s news with Unity is the first opportunity for “the rubber to meet the road” of engines that are operating together.
For now, whether a creator makes a Fortnite experience using Fortnite’s tools or with Unity, Sweeney says there will be a review process to ensure that it’s “ratings-compliant and works adequately.” But in the future, “as this evolves into a completely open system, we’d only have reviews for stuff that we host, and anybody would be able to put anything anywhere, and people would be able to browse to it like you do in a web browser today.”
Allowing Unity games will “greatly expand the developer base,” Sweeney says. “The challenge of building content in Fortnite today is you start from scratch.” You can’t currently take an Unreal Engine game and deploy it into Fortnite — that’s something that Epic is aiming for with Unreal Engine 6, which is likely years away. Ironically, Sweeney says, “publishing Unity games into Fortnite will happen before publishing standalone Unreal Engine games into Fortnite.”
There’s a second component to today’s news, too: Unity will bring support for Unreal Engine to the commerce management platform it announced last month, which lets developers manage their digital storefronts across many platforms from all inside Unity Engine. That was pitched at the time as a way to make it much easier to deal with the complexities of different storefronts and payment processors.
Bringing support for Unreal Engine to the platform gives developers “more choice around how they build stores and how they manage those stores,” Bromberg says. “Ultimately, I think the thing that Tim and I couldn’t agree any more strongly on is that having more choice and more places where developers can build things and giving them more control over their destinies is the most important thing we can do to help the gaming ecosystem.”

items.title: Meross发布无线版MS605雷达存在传感器，支持Matter-over-Thread
items.summary: 智能家居品牌**Meross**宣布推出其MS600存在传感器的新版MS605，这款新设备采用电池供电，不再受限于电源线，使得安装更加灵活。MS605使用一颗CR123A电池，续航时间可达三年，但在人流量大的区域，如果传感器频繁激活，电池寿命可能会缩短。目前，MS605已在**Meross**在线商店开启预售，并限时优惠至34.99美元。新版传感器支持Matter-over-Thread协议，这是通过低功耗的Thread协议实现的。与仅支持Wi-Fi的旧版MS600相比，MS605需要家中有支持Thread的中枢设备才能与Google Home、Apple Home或Alexa配合使用，但这个中枢设备不必是**Meross**的产品。MS605保留了MS600的设计，并增加了IP67防水等级，使其可以户外使用。它同样集成了光感、被动红外（PIR）和24GHz毫米波雷达传感器，用以检测移动或静止的人，并区分如窗帘等非人的移动物体。唯一的缺点是，由于采用电池供电，MS605的动作检测范围从12米减少到6米，存在检测范围从6米减少到4米。
comments: 这个无线传感器看起来真的很方便，不用到处找电源插座了，而且支持Matter协议，兼容性更强，期待入手体验！
电池供电虽然方便，但是续航三年是不是有点夸张？希望实际使用中不要让我频繁更换电池。
支持Thread协议是个好消息，但是我家现在还没有Thread中枢，看来还得先升级一下我的智能家居系统。
防水功能很实用，这样我就可以把它放在户外了，监控花园或者阳台的情况。
虽然范围减少了，但是6米对于家庭使用来说应该足够了，而且无线安装真的很吸引人，希望价格能保持亲民。
items.originalTitle: Meross’ radar presence sensor ditches the cord and adds Matter-over-Thread support
items.originalSummary:
The MS605 has an articulated installation plate allowing the angle of the sensor to be adjusted. | Image: Meross	

Meross has announced a new version of its MS600 presence sensor that’s now battery-powered, so installation isn’t limited to places where you can camouflage a power cord. 
A single CR123A battery powers the new MS605 presence sensor for up to three years. Battery life may be reduced in high-traffic areas if the sensor is activated more frequently. It’s available for preorder now through Meross’ online store and discounted to $34.99 for a limited time.
The switch to battery power is made possible by another new feature: support for Matter over the low-power Thread protocol. The MS605’s year-old predecessor was also Matter-compatible, but over Wi-Fi. You’ll need to make sure you have a Thread-capable hub somewhere in your home to use the MS605 with Google Home, Apple Home, or Alexa, but it doesn’t have to be a Meross hub.
The MS605 has a similar design to the older MS600 and carries forward its articulated mounting plate, allowing the sensor to be angled up to 90 degrees and rotated 360 degrees. It’s been upgraded with an IP67 waterproof rating so it can now be used outdoors. It also offers the same combination of light, passive infrared (PIR), and 24GHz mmWave radar sensors used to detect people in motion or standing still, and to differentiate inanimate moving objects, like a window curtain, from humans. The only real downside to the battery is that the MS605’s range has been reduced to 6 meters (from 12) for motion and 4 meters (from 6) for presence detection.

comments: Salesforce的AI技术确实有潜力，但目前看来还不足以让我放心投资。
我觉得Salesforce的AI业务还有很大的发展空间，现在不买，以后可能会后悔。
Salesforce的AI技术虽然不错，但竞争对手也很强，股价上涨的空间有限。
我对Salesforce的AI技术持怀疑态度，感觉他们只是在跟风炒作。

items.title: 谷歌发布第三代**Gemini AI模型**及**AI优先IDE**——**Antigravity**
items.summary: 谷歌的旗舰人工智能模型今年迎来了第二次重大升级。**Gemini 3 AI模型**的发布标志着谷歌在人工智能领域的进一步深入。这款新的AI模型预计将在多个领域带来性能的提升和新的可能性。同时，谷歌还推出了名为**Antigravity**的AI优先集成开发环境（IDE），这将为开发者提供一个更加强大和便捷的工具，以促进AI技术的开发和应用。**Antigravity**的推出，可能会改变开发者与AI技术互动的方式，使得AI技术的集成和开发变得更加直观和高效。
comments: 谷歌在AI领域的步伐越来越快了，期待**Gemini 3**和**Antigravity**能带来革命性的变化！
这是不是意味着我们很快就能用上更智能的谷歌助手了？
谷歌的AI技术一直走在前列，这次的升级肯定又会带来不少惊喜。

items.title: “大梗重置”即将到来
items.summary: 从**杰克·多西**到**Gen Alpha**，似乎每个人都想回到十年前的互联网。但是否可能逆转**人工智能**的泛滥和大脑的退化呢？近年来，随着**人工智能**技术的发展和普及，互联网上的内容质量似乎有所下降，人们对于简单、快速、娱乐化的内容越来越依赖，这导致了所谓的“梗文化”的兴起。然而，这种趋势也引发了人们的担忧，许多人开始怀念那个信息更加丰富、深入、有质量的互联网时代。现在，一些声音呼吁进行“大梗重置”，希望回归到更加理性、有深度的网络环境。但要实现这一目标，需要克服技术发展带来的挑战，以及人们对于快速消费内容的依赖。
comments: 这个想法太棒了！现在的互联网充斥着太多没营养的内容，是时候回归到有深度的讨论了。
我觉得这不太可能实现，人们已经习惯了快速消费内容，想要改变这种习惯太难了。
‘大梗重置’听起来很美好，但具体要怎么做呢？需要更多的细节和计划。
哈哈，‘大梗重置’，听起来像是要重启互联网一样。不过，如果真的能实现，我还是很期待的。
我认为这需要一个过程，不能一蹴而就。我们需要逐步引导人们改变消费习惯，提高内容的质量。
items.originalTitle: The ‘Great Meme Reset’ Is Coming
items.originalSummary: From Jack Dorsey to Gen Alpha, everyone seemingly wants to go back to the internet of a decade ago. But is it possible to reverse AI slop and brain rot?
items.marketReaction: 这一趋势可能会对内容创作和社交媒体行业产生影响。如果“大梗重置”真的发生，那么依赖于快速消费内容的平台，如**TikTok**和**Twitter**，可能会面临用户流失的风险。同时，那些能够提供高质量、深度内容的平台，如**Medium**和**知乎**，可能会因此受益，吸引更多寻求深度信息的用户。此外，这也可能会推动内容创作者更加注重内容的质量和深度，从而提高整个行业的标准。

items.title: MacOS 26中找不到启动台？这里有恢复方法

没有启动台的MacOS感觉就像少了点什么，希望这些替代方案能好用。
苹果总是喜欢改变我们习惯的东西，不过只要能解决问题，我还是愿意尝试的。
哈哈，苹果这是在逼我们用第三方启动器吗？感觉又回到了越狱时代。

items.title: 美国学校安装电子烟检测技术，引发洗手间监控热潮
items.summary: 随着电子烟和大麻在学生中的流行，美国学校开始在洗手间安装电子烟检测技术以阻止学生使用这些物质。一项新的调查揭示了使用监控技术解决问题的影响。这些技术能够检测到洗手间中的电子烟烟雾，从而帮助学校管理人员发现并阻止学生在校园内吸食电子烟和大麻。这一措施的实施，不仅提高了学校对此类行为的监控能力，也引发了对隐私和监控技术使用的广泛讨论。学校方面认为，这是保护学生健康和遵守法律的必要措施，而批评者则担忧这可能侵犯学生的隐私权。
comments: 这个措施太棒了，学校应该保护学生免受电子烟的危害，支持！
但是这样会不会侵犯学生的隐私呢？学校应该找到更平衡的方法来处理这个问题。
电子烟在学生中这么流行了吗？看来监管真的需要加强了。
这会不会导致学生对监控技术的反感，反而加剧了他们对电子烟的好奇心？
我觉得这个技术挺好的，至少可以减少学校里电子烟的滥用，保护孩子们的健康。

items.title: 马斯克的xAI公司发布Grok 4.1，降低幻觉率，提升用户体验
items.summary: 在谷歌即将发布其新的旗舰AI模型Gemini 3之前，埃隆·马斯克的人工智能初创公司xAI昨晚发布了其最新的大型语言模型**Grok 4.1**。该模型现在已在Grok.com、社交网络X（前Twitter）以及公司的iOS和Android移动应用上对消费者开放使用，并带来了重大的架构和可用性增强，包括更快的推理能力、提高的情感智能以及显著降低的幻觉率。xAI还发布了一份白皮书，详细介绍了其评估结果和训练过程。在公共基准测试中，**Grok 4.1**超越了Anthropic、OpenAI和谷歌的竞争对手模型，至少在谷歌发布Gemini 3之前是如此。尽管**Grok 4.1**在基准测试中表现出色，但它目前仅限于xAI的消费界面，没有宣布API开放的时间表。这意味着企业用户目前无法通过xAI的API将**Grok 4.1**集成到生产环境中。
comments: 哇，马斯克又搞了个大新闻，**Grok 4.1**听起来好厉害，期待它能带来更好的AI体验！
虽然**Grok 4.1**很强，但是没有API支持，对于我们这些开发者来说还是不够方便啊。
xAI这是要和谷歌正面硬刚的节奏啊，看看谁能笑到最后。
降低幻觉率是个好消息，之前的AI模型在这方面做得不够好，希望**Grok 4.1**能真正改善用户体验。
虽然我很看好xAI，但是没有API支持，这限制了**Grok 4.1**在企业级应用的潜力，希望他们能尽快解决这个问题。
items.originalTitle: Musk's xAI launches Grok 4.1 with lower hallucination rate on the web and apps — no API access (for now)
items.originalSummary:
In what appeared to be a bid to soak up some of Google's limelight prior to the launch of its new Gemini 3 flagship AI model — now recorded as the most powerful LLM in the world by multiple independent evaluators — Elon Musk's rival AI startup xAI last night unveiled its newest large language model, Grok 4.1.
The model is now live for consumer use on Grok.com, social network X (formerly Twitter), and the company’s iOS and Android mobile apps, and it arrives with major architectural and usability enhancements, among them: faster reasoning, improved emotional intelligence, and significantly reduced hallucination rates. xAI also commendably published a white paper on its evaluations and including a small bit on training process here.  
Across public benchmarks, Grok 4.1 has vaulted to the top of the leaderboard, outperforming rival models from Anthropic, OpenAI, and Google — at least, Google's pre-Gemini 3 model (Gemini 2.5 Pro). It builds upon the success of xAI's Grok-4 Fast, which VentureBeat covered favorably shortly following its release back in September 2025.
However, enterprise developers looking to integrate the new and improved model Grok 4.1 into production environments will find one major constraint: it's not yet available through xAI’s public API. 
Despite its high benchmarks, Grok 4.1 remains confined to xAI’s consumer-facing interfaces, with no announced timeline for API exposure. At present, only older models—including Grok 4 Fast (reasoning and non-reasoning variants), Grok 4 0709, and legacy models such as Grok 3, Grok 3 Mini, and Grok 2 Vision—are available for programmatic use via the xAI developer API. These support up to 2 million tokens of context, with token pricing ranging from $0.20 to $3.00 per million depending on the configuration.
For now, this limits Grok 4.1’s utility in enterprise workflows that rely on backend integration, fine-tuned agentic pipelines, or scalable internal tooling. While the consumer rollout positions Grok 4.1 as the most capable LLM in xAI’s portfolio, production deployments in enterprise environments remain on hold.
Model Design and Deployment Strategy
Grok 4.1 arrives in two configurations: a fast-response, low-latency mode for immediate replies, and a “thinking” mode that engages in multi-step reasoning before producing output. 
Both versions are live for end users and are selectable via the model picker in xAI’s apps.
The two configurations differ not just in latency but also in how deeply the model processes prompts. Grok 4.1 Thinking leverages internal planning and deliberation mechanisms, while the standard version prioritizes speed. Despite the difference in architecture, both scored higher than any competing models in blind preference and benchmark testing.
Leading the Field in Human and Expert Evaluation
On the LMArena Text Arena leaderboard, Grok 4.1 Thinking briefly held the top position with a normalized Elo score of 1483 — then was dethroned a few hours later with Google's release of Gemini 3 and its incredible 1501 Elo score. 
The non-thinking version of Grok 4.1 also fares well on the index, however, at 1465. 
These scores place Grok 4.1 above Google’s Gemini 2.5 Pro, Anthropic’s Claude 4.5 series, and OpenAI’s GPT-4.5 preview.
In creative writing, Grok 4.1 ranks second only to Polaris Alpha (an early GPT-5.1 variant), with the “thinking” model earning a score of 1721.9 on the Creative Writing v3 benchmark. This marks a roughly 600-point improvement over previous Grok iterations. 
Similarly, in the Arena Expert leaderboard, which aggregates feedback from professional reviewers, Grok 4.1 Thinking again leads the field with a score of 1510.
The gains are especially notable given that Grok 4.1 was released only two months after Grok 4 Fast, highlighting the accelerated development pace at xAI.
Core Improvements Over Previous Generations
Technically, Grok 4.1 represents a significant leap in real-world usability. Visual capabilities—previously limited in Grok 4—have been upgraded to enable robust image and video understanding, including chart analysis and OCR-level text extraction. Multimodal reliability was a pain point in prior versions and has now been addressed.
Token-level latency has been reduced by approximately 28 percent while preserving reasoning depth. 
In long-context tasks, Grok 4.1 maintains coherent output up to 1 million tokens, improving on Grok 4’s tendency to degrade past the 300,000 token mark.
xAI has also improved the model's tool orchestration capabilities. Grok 4.1 can now plan and execute multiple external tools in parallel, reducing the number of interaction cycles required to complete multi-step queries. 
According to internal test logs, some research tasks that previously required four steps can now be completed in one or two.
Other alignment improvements include better truth calibration—reducing the tendency to hedge or soften politically sensitive outputs—and more natural, human-like prosody in voice mode, with support for different speaking styles and accents.
Safety and Adversarial Robustness
As part of its risk management framework, xAI evaluated Grok 4.1 for refusal behavior, hallucination resistance, sycophancy, and dual-use safety.
The hallucination rate in non-reasoning mode has dropped from 12.09 percent in Grok 4 Fast to just 4.22 percent — a roughly 65% improvement.
The model also scored 2.97 percent on FActScore, a factual QA benchmark, down from 9.89 percent in earlier versions.
In the domain of adversarial robustness, Grok 4.1 has been tested with prompt injection attacks, jailbreak prompts, and sensitive chemistry and biology queries. 
Safety filters showed low false negative rates, especially for restricted chemical knowledge (0.00 percent) and restricted biological queries (0.03 percent). 
The model’s ability to resist manipulation in persuasion benchmarks, such as MakeMeSay, also appears strong—it registered a 0 percent success rate as an attacker.
Limited Enterprise Access via API
Despite these gains, Grok 4.1 remains unavailable to enterprise users through xAI’s API. According to the company’s public documentation, the latest available models for developers are Grok 4 Fast (both reasoning and non-reasoning variants), each supporting up to 2 million tokens of context at pricing tiers ranging from $0.20 to $0.50 per million tokens. These are backed by a 4M tokens-per-minute throughput limit and 480 requests per minute (RPM) rate cap.
By contrast, Grok 4.1 is accessible only through xAI’s consumer-facing properties—X, Grok.com, and the mobile apps. This means organizations cannot yet deploy Grok 4.1 via fine-tuned internal workflows, multi-agent chains, or real-time product integrations.
Industry Reception and Next Steps
The release has been met with strong public and industry feedback. Elon Musk, founder of xAI, posted a brief endorsement, calling it “a great model” and congratulating the team. AI benchmark platforms have praised the leap in usability and linguistic nuance.
For enterprise customers, however, the picture is more mixed. Grok 4.1’s performance represents a breakthrough for general-purpose and creative tasks, but until API access is enabled, it will remain a consumer-first product with limited enterprise applicability.
As competitive models from OpenAI, Google, and Anthropic continue to evolve, xAI’s next strategic move may hinge on when—and how—it opens Grok 4.1 to external developers.
items.marketReaction: xAI的这一举措可能会对市场产生显著影响。尽管**Grok 4.1**目前仅限于消费级应用，但其在基准测试中的领先地位可能会吸引更多用户转向使用xAI的产品，从而可能提升公司的品牌影响力和市场份额。然而，由于企业用户无法通过API访问**Grok 4.1**，这可能会限制其在企业级市场的快速扩张。对于投资者而言，xAI的这一进展可能会被视为积极的，因为它显示了公司在AI领域的竞争力和创新能力，但同时也可能会对公司的长期增长前景持谨慎态度，直到**Grok 4.1**对企业用户开放。

items.title: 微软重塑Windows操作系统，迎接自主AI代理时代
items.summary: 微软正在彻底重组其Windows操作系统，将其转变为所谓的“代理操作系统”，嵌入了自主AI代理在企业规模上安全运行所需的基础设施。这一转变标志着个人计算机演变中的一个分水岭时刻，将这个40年历史的平台定位为新时代人机协作的基础。在Ignite大会上，微软宣布将原生代理基础设施直接引入Windows 11，允许AI代理——能够代表用户执行复杂、多步骤任务的自主软件程序——通过标准化协议发现工具、执行工作流程，并与应用程序交互，同时在与用户会话分开的安全、受策略控制的环境中运行。这一变化是微软自现代安全模型引入以来Windows最重要的架构演变，将操作系统从一个用户手动协调应用程序的平台转变为一个用户可以“简单地表达期望结果，代理处理复杂性”的平台。微软认为，只有操作系统级别的集成才能解决企业在实验AI代理时面临的工具分散、安全问题和缺乏集中管理的挑战。考虑到Windows在全球约有14亿设备上运行，微软的架构选择可能会影响组织部署自主AI系统的方式，这一赌注是巨大的。
comments: 哇，微软这是要开启一个新的时代啊，AI代理听起来好科幻，期待实际应用的效果！
这是不是意味着我们以后可以更懒了？让AI帮我们做更多事情，听起来不错。
有点担心安全问题，AI代理会不会被黑客利用？微软得确保这些代理的安全性。
这会不会让很多人失业？AI能做那么多事，我们人类的位置在哪里？
微软这一步棋走得挺妙的，把AI和操作系统结合，这可能会成为他们的一大竞争优势。
items.originalTitle: Microsoft remakes Windows for an era of autonomous AI agents
items.originalSummary:
Microsoft is fundamentally restructuring its Windows operating system to become what executives call the first "agentic OS," embedding the infrastructure needed for autonomous AI agents to operate securely at enterprise scale — a watershed moment in the evolution of personal computing that positions the 40-year-old platform as the foundation for a new era of human-machine collaboration.
The company announced Tuesday at its Ignite conference that it is introducing native agent infrastructure directly into Windows 11, allowing AI agents — autonomous software programs that can perform complex, multi-step tasks on behalf of users — to discover tools, execute workflows, and interact with applications through standardized protocols while operating in secure, policy-controlled environments separate from user sessions.
The shift is Microsoft's most significant architectural evolution of Windows since the introduction of the modern security model, transforming the operating system from a platform where users manually orchestrate applications into one where they can "simply express your desired outcome, and agents handle the complexity," according to Pavan Davuluri, President of Windows & Devices at Microsoft.
"Windows 11 starts with this notion of secure by design, secure by default," Davuluri said in an exclusive interview with VentureBeat. "And a lot of the work that we're doing today, when we think about the engagement we have with our customers, the expectations they have with us is making sure we are building upon the fact that Windows is the most secure platform for them and is the most resilient platform as well."
The announcements arrive as enterprises are experimenting with AI agents but struggling with fragmented tooling, security concerns, and lack of centralized management — challenges that Microsoft believes only operating system-level integration can solve. The stakes are enormous: with Windows running on an estimated 1.4 billion devices globally, Microsoft's architectural choices will likely shape how organizations deploy autonomous AI systems for years to come.
New platform primitives create foundation for agent computing
At the core of Microsoft's vision are three new platform capabilities entering preview that fundamentally change how agents operate on Windows. Agent Connectors provide native support for the Model Context Protocol (MCP), an open standard introduced by Anthropic that allows AI agents to connect with external tools and data sources. Microsoft has built what it calls an "on-device registry" — a secure, manageable repository where developers can register their applications' capabilities as agent connectors, making them discoverable to any compatible agent on the system.
"These are platform capabilities that then become available to all of our customers," Davuluri explained, describing how the Windows file system, for example, becomes an agent connector that any MCP-compatible agent can access with user consent. "We're able to do this in a fashion that can scale for one but it also allows others to participate in the Windows registry for MCP."
The architecture introduces an MCP proxy layer that handles authentication, authorization, and auditing for all communication between agents and connectors. Microsoft is launching with two built-in agent connectors for File Explorer and System Settings, allowing agents to manage files or adjust system configurations like switching between light and dark mode — all with explicit user permission.
Agent Workspace, entering private preview, represents perhaps the most significant security innovation. It creates what Microsoft describes as "a contained, policy-controlled, and auditable environment where agents can interact with software" — essentially a parallel desktop session where agents operate with their own distinct identity, completely separate from the user's primary session.
"We want to be able to have clarity in the identity of the agent that is operating in the local operating system," Davuluri said, addressing security concerns about agents accessing sensitive data. "We want that session to be a session that is secure, that is policy control, that is manageable, that has transparency and auditability."
Each agent workspace runs with minimal privileges by default, accessing only explicitly granted resources. The system maintains detailed audit logs distinguishing agent actions from user actions — critical for enterprises that need to prove compliance and track all changes to systems and data.
Windows 365 for Agents extends this infrastructure to the cloud, turning Microsoft's Cloud PC offering into execution environments for agents. Instead of running on local devices, agents can operate in secure, policy-controlled virtual machines in Azure, enabling what Microsoft calls "computer-using agents" to interact with legacy applications and perform automation tasks at scale without consuming local compute resources.
Taskbar becomes command center for monitoring AI agents at work
The infrastructure enables significant user interface changes designed to make agents as commonplace as applications. Microsoft is introducing "Ask Copilot on the taskbar," a unified entry point in preview that combines Microsoft 365 Copilot, agent invocation, and traditional search in a single interface.
Users will be able to invoke agents using "@" mentions directly from the taskbar, then monitor their progress through familiar UI patterns like hover cards, progress badges, and notifications — all while continuing other work. When an agent completes a task or needs input, it surfaces updates through the taskbar without disrupting the user's primary workflow.
"We've evolved and created new UX in the taskbar to reflect the unique needs of agents performing background tasks on your behalf," said Navjot Virk, Corporate Vice President of Windows Experiences, describing features like progress bars and status badges that indicate when agents are working, need approval, or have completed tasks.
The design philosophy, Virk emphasized, centers on user control. "These experiences are designed to be opt in. We want to give customers full control over when and how they engage with copilots and agents."
For commercial Microsoft 365 Copilot users, the integration goes deeper. Microsoft is embedding Copilot directly into File Explorer, allowing users to ask questions, generate summaries, or draft emails based on document contents without leaving the file management interface. On Copilot+ PCs — devices with neural processing units capable of 40 trillion operations per second — new capabilities include converting any on-screen table into an Excel spreadsheet through the Click to Do feature.
Microsoft bets on open standards against Apple and Google's proprietary approaches
Microsoft's embrace of the open Model Context Protocol, created by Anthropic, marks a strategic bet on openness as enterprises evaluate competing AI platforms from Apple and Google that use proprietary frameworks.
"Windows is an open platform, and by virtue [of being] an open platform, we certainly have the ability to take existing technologies, evolve, harden, adapt those, but we also allow customers to bring their own capabilities to the platform as well," Davuluri said when asked about competing with Apple Intelligence and Google's Android AI for Enterprise.
The company demonstrated this openness with Claude, Anthropic's AI assistant, accessing the Windows file system through agent connectors with user consent — one of numerous partnerships Microsoft has secured. Dynamics 365 is using the File Explorer connector to streamline expense reporting, reducing what was previously a 30-minute, dozen-step process to "one sentence with high accuracy," according to Microsoft's blog post. Other early partners include Manus AI, Dropbox Dash, Roboflow, and Infosys.
"Windows is the platform in which they build upon," Davuluri said of enterprise customers. "And so our ability to take those existing bodies of work they have, and extend them is the, I think, the least friction way for them to go, learn, adopt, experiment and find ways to [scale]."
Security model enforces strict containment and mandatory user consent
Microsoft's security model for agents adheres to what it calls "secure by default" policies aligned with the company's broader Secure Future Initiative. All agent connectors registered in the on-device registry must meet strict requirements around packaging and identity, with applications properly packaged and signed by trusted sources. Developers must explicitly declare the minimum capabilities their agent connectors require, and agents and connectors run in isolated environments with dedicated agent user accounts, separate from human user accounts. Windows requires explicit user approval when agents first access sensitive resources like files or system settings.
"We give Windows the ability to go deliver on the security expectations, and then it is auditable at the end of the day," Davuluri said. "You still want an auditability log that looks similar to perhaps what you use in the cloud. And so all three pieces are built into the design and architecture of Agent Workspace."
For IT administrators, Microsoft is introducing management policies through Intune and Group Policy that allow organizations to enable or disable agent features at device and account levels, set minimum security policy levels, and access event logs enumerating all agent connector invocations and errors. The company emphasized that agents operate with restricted privileges, with minimal permissions by default and access granted only to explicitly approved resources that users can revoke at any time. 
Post-quantum cryptography and recovery tools address emerging and persistent threats
Beyond agent infrastructure, Microsoft announced significant security and resilience updates addressing both emerging and persistent enterprise challenges. Post-Quantum Cryptography APIs are now generally available in Windows, allowing organizations to begin migrating to encryption algorithms designed to withstand future quantum computing attacks that could break today's cryptographic standards. Microsoft worked closely with the National Institute of Standards and Technology to implement these algorithms.
"We are introducing post quantum cryptography APIs in Windows," Davuluri said. "For customers who want to be able to do cryptographic encryption in their workloads, they can start taking advantage of these APIs in Windows for the first time. That is a huge step forward for us when we think about the future of windows."
Hardware-accelerated BitLocker will arrive on new devices starting spring 2026, offloading disk encryption to dedicated silicon for faster performance while providing hardware-level key protection. Sysmon functionality is becoming generally available as part of Windows in early 2026, bringing advanced forensics and threat detection capabilities previously available only as a separate download directly into the operating system's event logging system.
The company also detailed progress on its Windows Resiliency Initiative, launched a year ago following the CrowdStrike incident that disrupted 8.5 million Windows devices globally. New recovery capabilities include Quick Machine Recovery with expanded networking support and Autopatch management, allowing IT to remotely fix devices stuck in Windows Recovery Environment. Point-in-time restore entering preview rolls back devices to earlier states to resolve update conflicts or configuration errors, while Cloud rebuild in preview allows IT to remotely rebuild malfunctioning devices by downloading fresh installation media and using Autopilot for zero-touch provisioning.
Microsoft is also raising security requirements for third-party drivers across the Windows ecosystem. Following updated requirements for antivirus drivers effective April 1, 2025, the company is expanding this approach to other driver classes including networking, cameras, USB, printers, and storage — requiring higher certification standards, adding compiler safeguards, and providing more Windows in-box drivers to reduce reliance on third-party kernel-mode code.
Measured rollout reflects enterprise caution around autonomous software
Microsoft is positioning these updates as essential infrastructure for what it calls "Frontier Firms" — organizations that "blend human ingenuity with intelligent systems to deliver real outcomes." However, the company emphasized a cautious, opt-in approach that reflects enterprise concerns about autonomous software agents.
"The principles we're using in designing these new platform capabilities accounts for the reality that we have a very, very broad user base," Davuluri said. "A lot of the features and capabilities we're building are opt in capabilities. And so it is our goal to be able to have users find value in the workflow and meet them."
Virk emphasized the measured approach: "This is more about meeting customers where they are and then taking them on this journey when they are ready. So there's the optionality, but also having support for it. And really important thing is that they should feel comfortable. They should feel secure."
Microsoft's bet is that only operating system-level integration can provide the security, governance, and user experience required for mainstream AI agent adoption. Whether that vision materializes will depend on developer adoption, enterprise comfort with autonomous software, and Microsoft's ability to balance innovation with the stability that 40 years of Windows customers expect. After four decades of putting users in control of their computers, Windows is now asking them to share that control with machines.
items.marketReaction: 微软的这一举措可能会对市场产生深远影响。首先，它可能会增强Windows系统的竞争力，吸引更多寻求集成AI解决方案的企业用户。其次，这可能会推动**AI**和**自动化**相关股票的增长，因为市场对这类技术的需求可能会增加。此外，微软的这一战略可能会促使其他科技公司，如**苹果**和**谷歌**，加快开发自己的AI集成解决方案，从而推动整个行业的创新和发展。

items.title: 谷歌发布Gemini 3，宣称在数学、科学、多模态和代理AI基准测试中领先
items.summary: 经过一个多月的传言和热烈猜测，谷歌今天发布了其最新的专有前沿模型家族**Gemini 3**，这是自2023年**Gemini**系列首次亮相以来，公司最全面的AI发布。这些模型是专有（闭源）的，仅通过谷歌产品、开发者平台和付费API提供，包括**Google AI Studio**、**Vertex AI**、面向开发者的**Gemini**命令行界面（CLI）以及更广泛的集成开发者环境（IDE）生态系统中的第三方集成。**Gemini 3**作为一个完整的产品组合推出，包括：**Gemini 3 Pro**（旗舰前沿模型）、**Gemini 3 Deep Think**（增强推理模式）、为视觉布局和动态视图提供动力的生成界面模型、**Gemini Agent**（多步任务执行）以及嵌入在谷歌新的代理优先开发环境**Google Antigravity**中的**Gemini 3**引擎。这一发布标志着谷歌在竞争激烈的AI领域中的一大步，展现了其在硬件、数据中心基础设施和消费产品方面的控制力。
comments: 谷歌这次真的放大招了，**Gemini 3**的性能提升太惊人了，看来AI领域的竞争要进入新阶段了。
虽然性能提升很吸引人，但是价格也不菲啊，对于小公司和个人开发者来说，成本是个大问题。
**Gemini 3**的发布证明了谷歌在AI技术上的领导地位，这对于推动整个行业的发展都是好消息。
看到**Gemini 3**在多模态和代理AI方面的进步，我对未来的AI应用更加期待了，这将打开新的可能性。
谷歌的保密工作做得真好，之前一点风声都没有，突然就发布了这么强大的产品，真是让人惊喜。
items.originalTitle: Google unveils Gemini 3 claiming the lead in math, science, multimodal and agentic AI benchmarks
items.originalSummary:
After more than a month of rumors and feverish speculation — including Polymarket wagering on the release date — Google today unveiled Gemini 3, its newest proprietary frontier model family and the company’s most comprehensive AI release since the Gemini line debuted in 2023. 
The models are proprietary (closed-source), available exclusively through Google products, developer platforms, and paid APIs, including Google AI Studio, Vertex AI, the Gemini command line interface (CLI) for developers, and third-party integrations across the broader integrated developer environment (IDE) ecosystem.
Gemini 3 arrives as a full portfolio, including:

Gemini 3 Pro: the flagship frontier model

Gemini 3 Deep Think: an enhanced reasoning mode

Generative interface models powering Visual Layout and Dynamic View

Gemini Agent for multi-step task execution

Gemini 3 engine embedded in Google Antigravity, the company’s new agent-first development environment.

"This is the best model in the world, by a crazy wide margin!" wrote Google DeepMind Research Scientist Yi Tay on X. 
Indeed, already, independent AI benchmarking and analysis organization Artificial Analysis has crowned Gemini 3 Pro the "new leader in AI" globally, achieving the top score of 73 on the organization's index, leaping Google from its former placement of 9th overall with the preceding Gemini 2.5 Pro model, which scored 60 behind OpenAI, Moonshot AI, xAI, Anthropic and MiniMax models. As Artificial Analysis wrote on X: "For the first time, Google has the most intelligent model."
Another independent leaderboard site, LMArena reported that Gemini 3 Pro ranked first in the world across all of its major evaluation tracks, including text reasoning, vision, coding, and web development. 
In a public post, the @arena account on X said the model surpassed even the newly released (hours old) Grok-4.1, as well as Claude 4.5, and GPT-5-class systems in categories such as math, long-form queries, creative writing, and several occupational benchmarks. 

The post also highlighted the scale of gains over Gemini 2.5 Pro, including a 50-point jump in text Elo, a 70-point increase in vision, and a 280-point rise in web-development tasks. 
While these results reflect live community voting and remain preliminary, they signal unusually broad performance improvements across domains where previous Gemini models trailed competitors.
What It Means For Google In the Hotly Competitive AI Race
The launch represents one of Google’s largest, most tightly coordinated model releases. 
Gemini 3 is shipping simultaneously across Google Search, the Gemini app, Google AI Studio, Vertex AI, and a range of developer tools. 
Executives emphasized that this integration reflects Google’s control of tensor processing unit (TPU — its homegrown Nvidia GPU rival chips) hardware, data center infrastructure, and consumer products. 
According to the company, the Gemini app now has more than 650 million monthly active users, more than 13 million developers build with Google’s AI tools, and more than 2 billion monthly users engage with Gemini-powered AI Overviews in Search.
At the center of the release is a shift toward agentic AI — systems that plan, act, navigate interfaces, and coordinate tools, rather than just generating text. 
Gemini 3 is designed to translate high-level instructions into multi-step workflows across devices and applications, with the ability to generate functional interfaces, run tools, and manage complex tasks.
Major Performance Gains Over Gemini 2.5 Pro
Gemini 3 Pro introduces large gains over Gemini 2.5 Pro across reasoning, mathematics, multimodality, tool use, coding, and long-horizon planning. Google’s benchmark disclosures show substantial improvements in many categories.
Gemini 3 Pro debuted at the top of the LMArena text-reasoning leaderboard, posting a preliminary Elo score of 1501 based on pre-release community voting — the first LLM to ever cross the 1500 threshold.
That places it above xAI’s newly announced Grok-4.1-thinking model (1484) and Grok-4.1 (1465), both of which were unveiled just hours earlier, as well as above Gemini 2.5 Pro (1451) and recent Claude Sonnet and Opus releases. 
While LMArena covers only text-reasoning performance and the results are labeled preliminary, this ranking positions Gemini 3 Pro as the strongest publicly evaluated model on that benchmark as of its launch day — though not necessarily the top performer in the world across all modalities, tasks, or evaluation suites.
In mathematical and scientific reasoning, Gemini 3 Pro scored 95 percent on AIME 2025 without tools and 100 percent with code execution, compared to 88 percent for its predecessor. 
On GPQA Diamond, it reached 91.9 percent, up from 86.4 percent. The model also recorded a major jump on MathArena Apex, reaching 23.4 percent versus 0.5 percent for Gemini 2.5 Pro, and delivered 31.1 percent on ARC-AGI-2 compared to 4.9 percent previously.
ARC-AGI-2 is the second-generation version of the Abstraction and Reasoning Corpus (ARC), a benchmark introduced by AI researcher François Chollet to measure generalization, not memorization. 
Unlike typical multiple-choice or dataset-based evaluations, ARC-AGI-2 presents models with tiny grid-based puzzles that require discovering and applying abstract rules. 
Each task provides a few input–output examples, and the model must infer the underlying transformation and apply it to a new test case. The problems span visual pattern recognition, symbolic manipulation, object transformations, spatial reasoning, and rule induction — all designed to test reasoning capabilities that do not depend on training-set familiarity.
The new ARC-AGI-2 variant is deliberately constructed to be out-of-distribution and resistant to memorization, making it one of the most difficult benchmarks for large language models. Its tasks are engineered to stress-test whether a model can infer a previously unseen rule purely from examples, a proxy for early forms of generalized problem-solving. 
Astonishingly, the "Deep Think" version of Gemini 3, designed to take longer to solve problems and use more reasoning, scored 45.1%, representing a substantial jump over prior frontier models, which typically score in the mid-teens to low-twenties. It also far exceeds Gemini 3 Pro’s 31.1% and is an order-of-magnitude improvement over older Gemini releases. 
These results suggest that Deep Think’s architecture is particularly effective at multi-step hypothesis generation, checking, and revision — the specific capabilities ARC-AGI-2 is designed to measure.
Multimodal performance increased across the board. Gemini 3 Pro scored 81 percent on MMMU-Pro, up from 68 percent, and 87.6 percent on Video-MMMU, compared to 83.6 percent. Its result on ScreenSpot-Pro, a key benchmark for agentic computer use, rose from 11.4 percent to 72.7 percent. Document understanding and chart reasoning also improved.
Coding and tool-use performance showed equally significant gains. The model’s LiveCodeBench Pro score reached 2,439, up from 1,775. On Terminal-Bench 2.0 it achieved 54.2 percent versus 32.6 percent previously. SWE-Bench Verified, which measures agentic coding through structured fixes, increased from 59.6 percent to 76.2 percent. The model also posted 85.4 percent on t2-bench, up from 54.9 percent.
Long-context and planning benchmarks indicate more stable multi-step behavior. Gemini 3 achieved 77 percent on MRCR v2 at 128k context (versus 58 percent) and 26.3 percent at 1 million tokens (versus 16.4 percent). Its Vending-Bench 2 score reached $5,478.16, compared to $573.64 for Gemini 2.5 Pro, reflecting stronger consistency during long-running decision processes.
Language understanding scores improved on SimpleQA Verified (72.1 percent versus 54.5 percent), MMLU (91.8 percent versus 89.5 percent), and the FACTS Benchmark Suite (70.5 percent versus 63.4 percent), supporting more reliable fact-based work in regulated sectors.
Generative Interfaces Move Gemini Beyond Text
Gemini 3 introduces a new class of generative interface capabilities in the consumer-facing Google Search AI Mode and for developers through Google AI Studio.
Visual Layout produces structured, magazine-style pages with images, diagrams, and modules tailored to the query. 
Dynamic View generates functional interface components such as calculators, simulations, galleries, and interactive graphs. 
These experiences will be available starting today globally in Google Search’s AI Mode, enabling models to surface information in visual, interactive formats beyond static text.
Developers can reproduce similar UI elements through Google AI Studio and the Gemini API, but the full consumer-facing interface types are not available as direct API outputs; instead, developers receive the underlying code or schema to render these components themselves. The branded Visual Layout and Dynamic View formats are therefore specific to Search and not exposed as standalone API features.
Google says the model analyzes user intent to construct the layout best suited to a task. In practice, this includes everything from automatically building diagrams for scientific concepts to generating custom UI components that respond to user input.
Google held a press call the day before the Gemini 3 announcement to brief reporters on the model family, its intended use cases, and how it differed from earlier Gemini releases. The call was led by multiple Google and DeepMind executives who walked through the model’s capabilities and framed Gemini 3 as a step toward more reliable, multi-step agentic systems that can operate across Google’s ecosystem.
During the briefing, speakers emphasized that Gemini 3 was engineered to support more consistent long-horizon reasoning, better tool use, and smoother planning loops than Gemini 2.5 Pro. 
One presenter said the model benefits from an architecture that allows it to generate and evaluate multiple hypotheses in parallel, improving reliability on mathematically hard questions and complex procedural tasks. 
Another speaker explained that Gemini 3’s improved spatial reasoning enables more robust interaction with interface elements, which supports agentic workflows across screens and applications.
Presenters highlighted growing enterprise adoption, noting strong demand for multimodal analysis, structured document reasoning, and agentic coding tools. They said Gemini 3’s performance on multimodal and scientific benchmarks reflected Google’s focus on grounded, verifiable reasoning. And they discussed Gemini 3's safety processes and improvements, including reduced sycophancy, stronger prompt-injection resistance, and a more structured evaluation pipeline guided by Google’s Frontier Safety Framework introduced back in 2024.
A portion of the call was dedicated to developer experience. Google described updates to its AI Studio and API that allow developers to control thinking depth, adjust model “resolution,” and combine new grounding tools with URL context and Search. 
Demoes showed Gemini 3 generating application interfaces, managing tool sequences, and debugging code in Antigravity, illustrating the model’s shift toward agentic operation rather than single-step generation.
The call positioned Gemini 3 as an upgrade across reasoning, planning, multimodal understanding, and developer workflows, with Google framing these advances as the foundation for its next generation of agent-driven products and enterprise services.
Gemini Agent Introduces Multi-Step Workflow Automation
Gemini Agent marks Google’s effort to move beyond conversational assistance toward operational AI. The system coordinates multi-step tasks across tools like Gmail, Calendar, Canvas, and live browsing. It reviews inboxes, drafts replies, prepares plans, triages information, and reasons through complex workflows, while requiring user approval before performing sensitive actions.
On a press call with journalists ahead of the release yesterday, Google said the agent is designed to handle multi-turn planning and tool-use sequences with consistency that was not feasible in earlier generations. 
It is rolling out first to Google AI Ultra subscribers in the Gemini app.
Google Antigravity and Developer Toolchain Integration
Antigravity is Google’s new agent-first development environment designed around Gemini 3. Developers collaborate with agents across an editor, terminal, and browser. The system orchestrates full-stack tasks, including code generation, UI prototyping, debugging, live execution, and report generation.
Across the broader developer ecosystem, Google AI Studio now includes a Build mode that automatically wires the right models and APIs to speed up AI-native app creation. Annotations support allows developers to attach prompts to UI elements for faster iteration. Spatial reasoning improvements enable agents to interpret mouse movements, screen annotations, and multi-window layouts to operate computer interfaces more effectively.
Developers also gain new reasoning controls through “thinking level” and “model resolution” parameters in the Gemini API, along with stricter validation of thought signatures for multi-turn consistency. A hosted server-side bash tool supports secure, multi-language code generation and prototyping. Grounding with Google Search and URL context can now be combined to extract structured information for downstream tasks.
Enterprise Impact and Adoption
Enterprise teams gain multimodal understanding, agentic coding, and long-horizon planning needed for production use cases. The new model unifies analysis of documents, audio, video, workflows, and logs. Improvements in spatial and visual reasoning support robotics, autonomous systems, and scenarios requiring navigation of screens and applications. High-frame-rate video understanding helps developers detect events in fast-moving environments.
Gemini 3’s structured document understanding capabilities support legal review, complex form processing, and regulated workflows. Its ability to generate functional interfaces and prototypes with minimal prompting reduces engineering cycles. In addition, the gains in system reliability, tool-calling stability, and context retention make multi-step planning viable for operations like financial forecasting, customer support automation, supply chain modeling, and predictive maintenance.
Developer and API Pricing
Google has disclosed initial API pricing for Gemini 3 Pro. 
In preview, the model is priced at $2 per million input tokens and $12 per million output tokens for prompts up to 200,000 tokens in Google AI Studio and Vertex AI. For prompts that require more than 200,000 tokens, the input pricing doubles to $2 per 1M tok, while the output rises to $18 per 1M tok.
When compared to the API pricing for other frontier AI models from rival labs, Gemini 3 is priced in the mid-high range, which may impact adoption as cheaper and open-source (permissively licensed) Chinese models have increasingly come to be adopted by U.S. startups. Here's how it stacks up:

Gemini 3 Pro is also available at no charge with rate limits in Google AI Studio for experimentation.
The company has not yet announced pricing for Gemini 3 Deep Think, extended context windows, generative interfaces, or tool invocation. 
Enterprises planning deployment at scale will require these details to estimate operational costs.
Multimodal, Visual, and Spatial Reasoning Enhancements
Gemini 3’s improvements in embodied and spatial reasoning support pointing and trajectory prediction, task progression, and complex screen parsing. These capabilities extend to desktop and mobile environments, enabling agents to interpret screen elements, respond to on-screen context, and unlock new forms of computer-use automation.
The model also delivers improved video reasoning with high-frame-rate understanding for analyzing fast-moving scenes, along with long-context video recall for synthesizing narratives across hours of footage. Google’s examples show the model generating full interactive demo apps directly from prompts, illustrating the depth of multimodal and agentic integration.
Vibe Coding and Agentic Code Generation
Gemini 3 advances Google’s concept of “vibe coding,” where natural language acts as the primary syntax. The model can translate high-level ideas into full applications with a single prompt, handling multi-step planning, code generation, and visual design. Enterprise partners like Figma, JetBrains, Cursor, Replit, and Cline report stronger instruction following, more stable agentic operation, and better long-context code manipulation compared to prior models.
Rumors and Rumblings
In the weeks leading up to the announcement, X became a hub of speculation about Gemini 3. 
Well-known accounts such as @slow_developer suggested internal builds were significantly ahead of Gemini 2.5 Pro and likely exceeded competitor performance in reasoning and tool use. Others, including @synthwavedd and @VraserX, noted mixed behavior in early checkpoints but acknowledged Google’s advantage in TPU hardware and training data. 
Viral clips from users like @lepadphone and @StijnSmits showed the model generating websites, animations, and UI layouts from single prompts, adding to the momentum.
Prediction markets on Polymarket amplified the speculation. Whale accounts drove the odds of a mid-November release sharply upward, prompting widespread debate about insider activity. A temporary dip during a global Cloudflare outage became a moment of humor and conspiracy before odds surged again.
The key moment came when users including @cheatyyyy shared what appeared to be an internal model-card benchmark table for Gemini 3 Pro. 
The image circulated rapidly, with commentary from figures like @deedydas and @kimmonismus arguing the numbers suggested a significant lead. 
When Google published the official benchmarks, they matched the leaked table exactly, confirming the document’s authenticity.
By launch day, enthusiasm reached a peak. A brief “Geminiii” post from Sundar Pichai triggered widespread attention, and early testers quickly shared real examples of Gemini 3 generating interfaces, full apps, and complex visual designs. 
While some concerns about pricing and efficiency appeared, the dominant sentiment framed the launch as a turning point for Google and a display of its full-stack AI capabilities.
Safety and Evaluation
Google says Gemini 3 is its most secure model yet, with reduced sycophancy, stronger prompt-injection resistance, and better protection against misuse. The company partnered with external groups, including Apollo and Vaultis, and conducted evaluations using its Frontier Safety Framework.
Deployment Across Google Products
Gemini 3 is available across Google Search AI Mode, the Gemini app, Google AI Studio, Vertex AI, the Gemini CLI, and Google’s new agentic development platform, Antigravity. Google says additional Gemini 3 variants will arrive later.
Conclusion
Gemini 3 represents Google’s largest step forward in reasoning, multimodality, enterprise reliability, and agentic capabilities. The model’s performance gains over Gemini 2.5 Pro are substantial across mathematical reasoning, vision, coding, and planning. Generative interfaces, Gemini Agent, and Antigravity demonstrate a shift toward systems that not only respond to prompts but plan tasks, construct interfaces, and coordinate tools. Combined with an unusually intense hype and leak cycle, the launch marks a significant moment in the AI landscape as Google moves aggressively to expand its presence across both consumer-facing and enterprise-facing AI workflows.
items.marketReaction: 谷歌此次发布可能会对市场产生显著影响。考虑到**Gemini 3**在多个AI基准测试中的领先地位，这可能会增强投资者对谷歌在AI领域竞争力的信心，从而可能对**谷歌**的股价产生积极影响。同时，由于**Gemini 3**的专有性质，它可能会推动更多开发者和企业采用谷歌的AI工具和平台，进一步扩大其在AI市场的份额。然而，**Gemini 3**的定价相对较高，可能会影响其在成本敏感的市场中的吸引力，尤其是在面对价格更低的开源中国模型的竞争时。

items.title: 共和党宽带许可法改革：城市反对，有线电视公司欢迎
items.summary: 近期，共和党提出了一项针对宽带许可法的改革计划，该计划被城市和县视为“前所未有的联邦干预”。这一改革计划可能会对宽带服务的提供和监管产生重大影响。城市和县认为，这一计划将削弱他们对宽带服务的控制权，而有线电视公司则对此表示欢迎，认为这将有助于他们更快速地部署宽带服务，减少繁文缛节。这一争议凸显了在宽带服务普及和监管方面，地方政府与私营企业之间的利益冲突。
comments: 这项改革对宽带服务的普及是好事，但政府的监管也很重要，不能让企业为所欲为。
城市和县的反对可以理解，毕竟这关系到他们的权力和利益，但长远来看，减少监管障碍对消费者是有利的。
共和党的这一计划可能会引发更多的争议，毕竟涉及到联邦和地方的权力分配问题。
如果这项改革真的能加快宽带服务的部署，那对消费者来说是个好消息，但也希望政府能保持一定的监管，确保服务质量。
这项改革计划听起来不错，但实施起来可能会有很多问题，毕竟每个地方的情况都不一样，一刀切的政策可能不太适合。
items.originalTitle: GOP overhaul of broadband permit laws: Cities hate it, cable companies love it
items.originalSummary: Cities and counties call Congressional plan an "unprecedented federal intrusion."
items.marketReaction: 这一改革计划可能会对宽带服务市场产生深远影响。如果该计划得以实施，**有线电视公司**可能会因为减少的监管障碍而获得更大的市场份额，这可能会对**宽带服务市场**的竞争格局产生影响。同时，这也可能对**地方政府**的监管权力产生削弱，影响他们对宽带服务的控制和规划。从股市角度来看，如果投资者预期这一改革将有利于**有线电视公司**，那么相关公司的股价可能会受到正面影响，而与地方政府合作紧密的宽带服务提供商可能会面临股价压力。

items.title: DoorDasher 面对裸体男子要求警方行动；警方以非法监视逮捕她
items.summary: 一名DoorDash送货员在面对一名在其家中裸体的男子时，要求警方采取行动。然而，警方却以非法监视的罪名对她提出了两项重罪指控。这起事件引发了关于个人隐私和监控行为的法律边界的讨论。送货员在执行工作职责时，是否应该对客户的私人生活进行记录，以及在何种情况下这种行为会构成犯罪，这些问题都成为了公众关注的焦点。**DoorDash**作为一家提供食品和商品配送服务的公司，其员工的行为规范和隐私政策也因此受到了审视。
comments: 这也太离谱了吧，送货员只是做了她认为正确的事情，怎么还被起诉了？
看来以后送外卖也得小心了，谁知道会不会因为保护客户隐私而被起诉呢？
这是不是说明**DoorDash**的员工培训不够到位？员工都不知道什么能做什么不能做。
我觉得这事儿双方都有责任，送货员不应该随便拍摄客户，但客户在家里裸体也应该注意隐私啊。
哈哈，这新闻太搞笑了，以后是不是要穿好衣服再点外卖？
items.originalTitle: Faced with naked man, DoorDasher demands police action; they arrest her for illegal surveillance
items.originalSummary: Two felony charges for filming man inside his house.
items.marketReaction: 此事件可能会对**DoorDash**的股价和市场声誉造成一定的负面影响。投资者和消费者可能会对公司的隐私政策和员工培训提出质疑，要求公司加强对员工行为的监管。同时，这也可能会引发对配送服务行业隐私保护措施的更广泛讨论，促使行业内其他公司加强相关政策的制定和执行。

items.title: CDC数据确认美国距离失去麻疹消除状态仅剩2个月
items.summary: 根据疾病控制与预防中心（**CDC**）的数据，如果麻疹病毒连续传播12个月，美国将失去麻疹消除状态。这意味着，如果在未来两个月内麻疹病毒继续在美国传播，美国将不再被视为已经消除了麻疹的国家。麻疹是一种高度传染性的疾病，对儿童尤其危险，可能导致严重的健康问题，包括肺炎和脑炎。失去麻疹消除状态不仅是公共卫生的失败，还可能对美国的国际形象和旅游产业造成影响。
comments: 这太可怕了，麻疹是一种严重的疾病，失去消除状态意味着我们的公共卫生系统存在严重问题。
希望这个消息能唤醒人们对疫苗的信任，保护我们的孩子免受这些可预防疾病的侵害。
这会不会影响我们的旅游业？如果其他国家开始限制美国人入境，那将是一场灾难。
我认为这只是一个时间问题，只要我们继续忽视公共卫生，更多的疾病将会回归。
这真是个坏消息，但也是个警钟。我们需要加强公共卫生措施，确保每个人都能接种疫苗。
items.originalTitle: CDC data confirms US is 2 months away from losing measles elimination status
items.originalSummary: Elimination status is lost if the virus spreads continuously for 12 months.
items.marketReaction: 这一消息可能会引起公众对疫苗接种重要性的关注增加，从而可能推动疫苗相关公司的股票价格上涨。同时，对旅游和航空业可能产生负面影响，因为人们可能会因为担心健康风险而避免前往美国旅行。投资者可能会密切关注与公共卫生和疫苗相关的公司，如**辉瑞**和**默克**，以及旅游和航空业的股票表现，如**美国航空**和**万豪国际**。

items.title: TikTok新增数字福祉工具：限制你的“末日滚动”可获得徽章
items.summary: 社交媒体平台**TikTok**正在引入一系列新的数字福祉工具，以帮助用户更好地管理他们在应用上的使用时间。这些新工具包括一个肯定日记、一个背景声音生成器，以及对于在应用内使用限制内的用户颁发的徽章。这些工具的引入旨在鼓励用户更加有意识地使用社交媒体，减少无意识的“末日滚动”行为，即用户在社交媒体上无目的地长时间滚动浏览，这种行为往往会导致焦虑和时间浪费。通过这些工具，**TikTok**希望用户能够更加积极地与平台互动，同时保持对个人福祉的关注。
comments: 这个功能太棒了，我经常在TikTok上刷到停不下来，现在有了这个徽章系统，我更有动力控制自己的使用时间了。
TikTok这是要转型成健康应用吗？不过说实话，这些工具确实能帮助我减少无意义的刷屏。
我觉得这个功能有点鸡肋，真正想控制使用时间的人不需要徽章也会自觉，不想控制的人给了徽章也没用。
哈哈，现在连刷TikTok都要内卷了吗？看谁的徽章多？不过这倒是挺有趣的，可能会吸引我多用用。
这个背景声音生成器听起来不错，有时候需要点白噪音来集中注意力，TikTok这个新功能挺贴心的。
items.originalTitle: TikTok will now give you badges for limiting your doomscrolling
items.originalSummary: TikTok is adding new digital wellbeing tools like an affirmation journal, a background sound generator, and badges for using the app within limits
items.marketReaction: 这一举措可能会对**TikTok**的用户留存率和活跃度产生积极影响，因为它显示出公司对用户福祉的重视，这可能会吸引更多的用户加入或增加现有用户的使用频率。同时，这也可能对其他社交媒体平台产生压力，促使它们也推出类似的福祉工具，以保持竞争力。从长远来看，这种对用户福祉的关注可能会成为社交媒体行业的一个新趋势，影响**股票市场**对相关公司的评估。

items.title: Emm 完成900万美元种子轮融资，打造全球首批“智能”月经杯
items.summary: 英国公司Emm于周三宣布，已完成由Lunar Ventures领投的900万美元（约合680万英镑）种子轮融资，为2026年正式推出智能月经杯做准备。这一创新产品将为女性健康领域带来革命性的变化，通过智能化技术提升女性在生理周期中的体验和健康管理。**Emm**的智能月经杯预计将在2026年面市，这不仅标志着女性健康科技的一大进步，也可能对传统卫生用品市场造成冲击。
comments: 哇，智能月经杯听起来好高科技，女性健康科技的进步真是让人兴奋！
900万美元的融资对于一个初创公司来说是个不错的开始，期待Emm的智能月经杯能带来革命性的变化。
智能月经杯？这听起来有点奇怪，但如果真的能改善女性的生活体验，那也是值得支持的。
Emm的这个项目如果能成功，可能会颠覆整个女性卫生用品市场，期待看到更多的创新产品。
虽然听起来很有前景，但智能月经杯的安全性和隐私保护问题也需要得到充分考虑。
items.originalTitle: Emm raises $9M seed to create one of the world’s first ‘smart’ menstrual cups
items.originalSummary: On Wednesday, Emm, based in the UK, announced a $9 million seed (£6.8 million) round led by Lunar Ventures as it prepares to officially launch the smart menstrual cup in 2026.
items.marketReaction: Emm的种子轮融资成功可能会吸引更多投资者关注女性健康科技领域，推动相关产品的研发和创新。对于**Emm**而言，这笔资金的注入将加速其产品开发和市场推广，有望在未来几年内看到其智能月经杯在市场上的表现。同时，这也可能对传统卫生用品制造商如**宝洁**、**尤妮佳**等造成一定的竞争压力，促使他们加快技术升级和产品创新。

items.title: 全电动Jeep Recon终于来了
items.summary: Jeep Recon，一款全电动SUV，估计续航里程为**250英里**，终于亮相，令人惊喜。原因如下。三年前，Jeep展示了其通过推出三款电动车型来重塑产品组合的计划——其中两款计划在**2024年**前进入北美市场。这款全电动的Jeep Recon就是其中之一。Jeep Recon的推出标志着Jeep品牌在电动化转型上迈出了重要一步，同时也为消费者提供了更多的绿色出行选择。随着全球对电动车需求的增长，Jeep Recon的上市可能会吸引那些既追求越野性能又注重环保的消费者。
comments: 终于等到Jeep出电动车了，期待已久的Recon看起来很不错，希望能尽快体验一下。
Jeep的电动化转型是大势所趋，但250英里的续航对于SUV来说是不是有点短？
Jeep Recon的外观设计很吸引人，如果性能和续航都能达到预期，我可能会考虑换车。
Jeep的电动化之路才刚刚开始，Recon只是第一步，期待未来能有更多惊喜。
哈哈，Jeep也开始玩电动了，不知道越野性能会不会受到影响，拭目以待。
items.originalTitle: The all-electric Jeep Recon is finally here
items.originalSummary: The Jeep Recon, an all-electric SUV with an estimated 250 miles of range, is here, and I couldn’t be more surprised. Here’s why. Three years ago, Jeep unveiled how it was reshaping its portfolio with the launch of three EVs — two of which were bound for the North American market by 2024. The all-electric […]
items.marketReaction: Jeep Recon的上市可能会对Jeep品牌的股票产生积极影响，尤其是在电动车领域。投资者可能会对Jeep在电动化转型上的进展表示乐观，从而推动**Stellantis**集团（Jeep的母公司）的股价上涨。此外，Jeep Recon的推出也可能对整个SUV市场产生影响，推动其他汽车制造商加快电动化步伐，从而影响整个行业的发展趋势。

items.title: 罗宾汉首席信息官：市场抛售后的最佳策略是“保持冷静”
items.summary: 在市场经历抛售之后，投资者的最佳策略可能是“保持冷静”。这是罗宾汉首席信息官**斯蒂芬妮·吉尔德**给出的建议。她认为，在当前的市场环境下，投资者不应过度反应，而是应该保持耐心，等待市场稳定。这种策略有助于避免在市场波动中做出冲动的决策，从而可能减少不必要的损失。**斯蒂芬妮·吉尔德**强调，尽管市场存在不确定性，但长期投资的关键在于坚持投资原则，不被短期的市场波动所左右。
comments: 看来市场波动的时候，保持冷静真的很重要，我也要学习这种心态。
我觉得这个建议很有道理，但是说起来容易做起来难，市场一跌我就心慌。
斯蒂芬妮·吉尔德的建议很中肯，但是每个投资者的情况不同，不能一概而论。
哈哈，‘T-bill和冷静’，这个标题太有创意了，我喜欢这种幽默感。
我觉得这个建议有点过于简单化了，市场情况复杂多变，不是每个人都能‘坐以待毙’的。
items.originalTitle: T-bill and chill: Robinhood CIO on what to do after the selloff and the danger markets are ignoring
items.originalSummary: The best move investors can make right now may be to just ‘sit tight,’ says Robinhood’s CIO Stephanie Guild.
items.marketReaction: 这一建议可能会对市场产生稳定的影响，因为它鼓励投资者保持冷静，避免恐慌性抛售。对于**罗宾汉**这样的交易平台来说，这可能有助于减少交易量波动，维持平台的稳定性。同时，这也可能会对投资者的信心产生积极影响，因为他们可能会更倾向于长期持有投资，而不是频繁交易。从长远来看，这可能有助于减少市场的过度波动，促进市场的健康发展。

items.title: Lowe's在关键销售指标上超越Home Depot，并且盈利超出预期
items.summary: Lowe's公司的股票在可比销售增长未达预期但超过其主要竞争对手Home Depot的同时，盈利超出了预期。在零售业，可比销售增长是一个关键指标，它衡量了同一店铺在相同时间段内的销售增长情况。尽管Lowe's的可比销售增长没有达到市场预期，但其表现仍然超过了其主要竞争对手Home Depot，显示出Lowe's在市场竞争中的优势。此外，Lowe's的盈利超出了分析师的预期，这可能会增强投资者对公司未来业绩的信心。
comments: Lowe's这次的表现真不错，看来他们的策略奏效了，期待他们能继续保持这种势头。
虽然Lowe's的可比销售增长没有达到预期，但能超过Home Depot已经是个好消息了，希望他们能继续努力。
Lowe's的盈利超出预期，这是不是意味着他们的成本控制做得比较好？这对股东来说是个好消息。
Home Depot要小心了，Lowe's这次的表现可能会吸引更多的投资者转向Lowe's，市场竞争越来越激烈了。

items.title: 百威英博啤酒销量下滑，传其将斥资7亿美元收购葡萄酒冲饮制造商
items.summary: 全球最大的啤酒公司之一，拥有**百威**、**时代**和**米凯罗**等品牌的**安海斯-布希英博**（Anheuser-Busch InBev）据传正在与葡萄酒冲饮制造商**BeatBox**进行收购谈判，收购金额约为7亿美元。这一举措可能是为了应对其旗舰品牌**百威淡啤**（Bud Light）销量的下滑。**BeatBox**以其盒装葡萄酒冲饮产品而闻名，这种产品近年来在市场上越来越受欢迎。通过收购**BeatBox**，**安海斯-布希英博**可能寻求在非传统酒精饮料领域拓展业务，以吸引更多消费者，尤其是年轻群体。

items.title: 2025年11月18日Cloudflare服务中断事后分析
items.summary: Cloudflare在2025年11月18日经历了一次服务中断，这次中断对全球许多网站和在线服务造成了影响。事后分析显示，这次中断是由于**Cloudflare**的网络配置错误引起的。这次服务中断持续了大约一个小时，影响了全球范围内的用户访问。**Cloudflare**是全球领先的内容分发网络（CDN）和分布式域名服务提供商，服务中断对其声誉和客户信任造成了一定的影响。此次事件也提醒了全球互联网基础设施的脆弱性，以及对关键服务提供商的依赖性。
comments: 这次中断真是太糟糕了，我的网站完全无法访问，损失了不少客户。希望**Cloudflare**能加强网络稳定性。
虽然中断时间不长，但影响真的很大。**Cloudflare**作为全球领先的CDN服务商，应该更加重视服务质量和稳定性。
这次事件让我意识到，我们对这些大型服务提供商的依赖性太大了。我们需要寻找更多的备份方案，以防万一。
哈哈，看来即使是**Cloudflare**这样的大公司也会犯错。不过，人非圣贤，孰能无过。关键是要吸取教训，避免重蹈覆辙。
我对**Cloudflare**的事后分析报告印象深刻。他们详细解释了问题的原因，并提出了改进措施。这显示了他们的透明度和责任感。希望他们能兑现承诺，提高服务质量。

items.title: 多模态扩散型语言模型：为思考感知编辑和生成而生
items.summary: 在人工智能领域，多模态扩散型语言模型（Multimodal Diffusion Language Models）是一种新兴技术，它结合了自然语言处理和计算机视觉，能够理解和生成包含文本、图像和声音等多种模态的数据。这种模型通过模拟人类思考过程，实现对信息的深度理解和创造性生成。它在编辑和生成内容时，能够考虑到上下文信息，提供更加丰富和准确的输出。例如，在图像描述任务中，模型不仅能够识别图像中的对象，还能根据对象之间的关系和场景背景生成描述性的文本。这种技术的发展，预示着人工智能在理解和生成复杂数据方面迈出了重要的一步，未来可能在内容创作、自动化设计和智能助手等领域发挥重要作用。
comments: 这个技术听起来好厉害，如果能应用到我的日常编辑工作中，那效率肯定能提高不少！
多模态扩散型语言模型，这个名字听起来就很高科技，不知道实际效果如何，希望能快点看到实际应用。
这种技术的发展，对于我们这些内容创作者来说，既是机遇也是挑战，我们得学会如何利用这些工具来提升自己的创作。
虽然听起来很酷，但我还是有点担心，这种技术会不会取代我们的工作？毕竟它看起来能做很多事情。
哈哈，以后是不是连写情书都可以用AI来代劳了？多模态扩散型语言模型，听起来就像是未来科技的产物。

items.title: 我为宕机检测器制作了一个宕机检测器

这个工具真的有用吗？我觉得宕机检测服务本身就应该足够可靠，不需要额外的工具来检测它们。
作为一个开发者，我觉得这个工具很有用。它可以帮助我们及时发现问题并采取措施，提高我们服务的稳定性。

这个工具的出现可能会让一些宕机检测服务感到压力，他们需要确保自己的服务足够稳定，否则就会被这个工具发现问题。

items.title: Klarna支付选项在Apple Pay扩展至西班牙、丹麦和瑞典
items.summary: Klarna，作为全球领先的支付和购物服务提供商，近日宣布其支付选项在Apple Pay上扩展至西班牙、丹麦和瑞典。这一扩展使得这些国家的消费者现在可以在使用Apple Pay时选择Klarna作为支付方式，享受更灵活的支付选项和购物体验。Klarna以其“先买后付”服务而闻名，允许用户分期付款购买商品，而无需支付额外费用。此次扩展不仅增强了Klarna的全球影响力，也为Apple Pay用户提供了更多的支付选择，预计将进一步推动数字支付在这些国家的普及和增长。

items.title: 提升设计到代码协作：GitHub开源注释工具包
items.summary: GitHub最近推出了一个名为**Annotation Toolkit**的开源工具，旨在帮助开发者在生产前预防可访问性问题。这个工具包能够将清晰度、合规性和协作性直接集成到Figma工作流程中。通过使用**Annotation Toolkit**，设计团队和开发团队可以更紧密地合作，确保设计在转化为代码时的准确性和可访问性。这对于提高产品的用户体验和满足法规要求至关重要。GitHub通过开源这一工具，进一步强化了其在开发者社区中的地位，促进了设计和代码之间的无缝协作。
comments: 这个工具看起来真的很有用，我们团队一直在寻找更好的设计到代码的协作方式，GitHub这次做得不错！
开源工具总是让人兴奋，希望这个**Annotation Toolkit**能够真正帮助我们提高工作效率。
我有点怀疑这个工具的实际效果，毕竟每个团队的工作流程都不一样，它真的能适应我们的需求吗？
